co2-calculation: Same reference and calculation as black tea. Black tea = 11.7 g CO2e / for 1.75 g of dry tea leaves. Processing is 6.6 g CO2e/1.75 g of dry tea leaves.
info-text: The main CO2 intensive processes for a cup of tea are the boiling of the water at household and the processing after harvesting the tea leaves.
references: Doublet & Jungbluth 2010. Life cycle assessment of drinking Darjeeling tea. Page 9, table 4.2
calculation-process-documentation:
Green tea is not fermented tea, the leaves are directly steamed after harvesting. 

Production country: India
Process includes cultivation, processing and first packaging, transport to Europe, retail.
origins: China, Kenya, India, Sri Lanka, Turkey
name: Grüntee
